result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew James Arrowood

records.addlTxt:
1:53 PM Defendant Matthew James Arrowood appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for Matthew James Arrowood.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court hears from Def. Atty Kaupie, has reviewed criminal complaint with def. and waives reading. Reserves rights and waives p.h. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court goes over waiver of rights with def. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over. Court hears from State on recommendations. Def. Atty. Zich is on other charges. Atty. Kaupie would like to continue with arraignment. State will file information. Atty Kaupie tracks criminal complaint, enters not guilty plea on all counts. Court receives not guilty plea. State gives following cases to be set for status 22cf34 21cf233 20cf54 & 18cf253. Atty Kaupie will be filing a bond modification. Bond continues
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls 18CF253, 20CF54, 21CF233 & 22CF34 @11:48 AM Defendant Matthew James Arrowood in court with attorney John Zich is on all 4 cases via zoom.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Mandatory appearance for defendant on the 14th.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:18 PM Defendant Matthew James Arrowood in court with attorney John Zich, via telephone.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading, reserve rights and waives time limits for p.h. Def. agrees to waive time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 04:00 PM Defendant Matthew James Arrowood in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:10 PM Defendant Matthew James Arrowood in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew James Arrowood appeared by video means. Def. is eligible for P.D. Bail/Bond hearing is scheduled. Bond Continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and to maintain absolute sobriety.

01:08 PM Defendant Matthew James Arrowood in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by Zoom.  Mrs. Arrowood appeared in court.  Court calls case and reviews.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Defendant pleas to contact public defender.  State gives cash bond recommendation of $10,000 with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant makes statement.  Attorney Gebert makes statement.  Mrs. Arrowood offers results to the Court.  Court denies.  Prior bond was posted for $10,000.  Court orders an additional cash bond of $11,000 with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and to maintain absolute sobriety.  Court is adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
